lines.gurmukhi: 1 gur cylw
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdI gwKVI ko ivrlw jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedee Gaakharhee Ko Viralaa Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Discipleship of the Guru is such a difficult task that only a rare one can understand it.

lines.gurmukhi: pIrw pIru vKwxIAY gur gurw vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Peeraa Peeru Vakhaaneeai Guru Guraan Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He, who knows it, becomes guide of spiritual guides and chief Guru of Gurus.

lines.gurmukhi: guru cylw cylw gurU kir coj ivfwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Kari Choj Vidaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In this stage the wonderful feat of becoming Guru by the disciple and vice-versa is enacted.

lines.gurmukhi: so guru soeI isK hY joqI joiq smwxY
lines.transliteration_english: So Guru Soee Sikhu Hai Jotee Joti Samaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Externally the Sikh and Guru remain as they were, but internally, the light of the one permeates the other.

lines.gurmukhi: ieku gurU ieku isKu hY guru sbid is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Guru Iku Sikhu Hai Guru Sabadi Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming the Sikh of the One Guru, the disciple understands the word of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: imhr muhbiq mylu kir Bau Bwau su BwxY ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Mihar Muhabati Maylu Kari Bhau Bhaau Su Bhaanai ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: Grace of the Guru and love of the disciple meeting together in the divine order join each other in the form of the love of the Guru and fear in the mind of the disciple to create a balanced and handsome personality.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 pIr QoN pIr hoxw

Shabad OS B.translation: Making of the Guru by the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKhu gur isKu hY pIr pIrhu koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhahu Gur Sikhu Hai Peer Peerahu Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: By the teachings of the Guru many become disciples of the Guru, but some rare one becomes the Guru like that Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: sbid suriq cylw gurU prmysru soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Surati Chaylaa Guroo Paramaysaru Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only the practitioner of the word and consciousness can attain the status of Guru-God.

lines.gurmukhi: drsin idsit iDAwnu Dir gur mUriq hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Darasani Disati Dhiaan Dhari Gur Moorati Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a disciple concentrating on the philosophy of the Guru (and making it a part of daily conduct) himself becomes a likeness of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq kr kIrqnu siqsMig ivloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Kari Keeratanu Satisangi Viloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Making his consciousness attentive to Word through recitation of Naam, he merges in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: vwihgurU gurmMqR hY jip haumY KoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Vaahiguroo Guramantr Hai Japi Haoumai Khoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His Guru-manta is Vahiguru, whose recitation erases egotism.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwey Awip hY gux guxI proeI ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaaay Aapi Hai Goun Gounee Paroee ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Losing egotism and merging into the qualities of the supreme Lord, he himself becomes full of qualities.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 sMjogI Awid vrnx

Shabad OS B.translation: Being fortunate

lines.gurmukhi: drsn idsit sMjog hY BY Bwie sMjogI
lines.transliteration_english: Darasan Disati Sanjogu Hai Bhai Bhaai Sanjogee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He, who has the opportunity of the glimpse of the Guru, is a fortunate person well aware of the virtues of love and awe.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq bYrwgu hY suK shj ArogI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Bairaagu Hai Soukh Sahaj Arogee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Adopting the renunciation in the form of Word consciousness, he residing in equipoise is free from all maladies.

lines.gurmukhi: mn bc krm n Brm hY jogIsru jogI
lines.transliteration_english: Man Bach Karam N Bharamu Hai Jogeesaru Jogee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His mind, speech and actions are not engrossed in delusions and he is king of the yogis.

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlw pIvxw AMmiRq rs BogI
lines.transliteration_english: Piram Piaalaa Peevanaa Anmrit Ras Bhogee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is the quaffer of the cup of love and remains merged in the delight of nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwnu iDAwnu ismrxu imlY pI AipE AsogI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Giaanu Dhiaanu Simaranu Milai Pee Apiao Asogee ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Drinking the elixir of knowledge, meditation and remembrance of the Lord, he has gone beyond all sorrows and sufferings.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 iprm rs

Shabad OS B.translation: Elixir of love

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rsu ikau AwiK vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Kiu Aakhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Quaffing the elixir of love giving fruits of delight, how could a gurmukh explain that ineffable joy?

lines.gurmukhi: suix suix AwKxu AwKxw Ehu swau n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Souni Souni Aakhanu Aakhanaa Aohu Saau N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Much is said and listened to but the people remain ignorant of its real taste.

lines.gurmukhi: bHmw ibsnu mhysu imil kiQ vyd purwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Mili Kadi Vayd Puraanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the Vedas and Puranas, Brahma, Visnu and Mahesa have told enough about the delight of love.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir kqybw AwKIAin dIn muslmwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Kataybaan Aakheeani Deen Mousalamaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: One can see the four scriptures of semitic religion in this context.

lines.gurmukhi: syKnwgu ismrxu krY swNgIq suhwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Saykhanaagu Simaranu Karai Saangeet Suhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sesanag also remembers it and all musical measures also are busy in adorning it.

lines.gurmukhi: Anhd nwd AsMK suix hoey hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Anahad Naad Asankh Souni Hoay Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: One becomes full of wonder after listening to the myriads of unstruck melodies,

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw kir nyq nyq pIlwey BwxY ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Kari Nayti Nayti Peelaaay Bhaanai ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: But the tale of that elixir, love, is ineffable which one fortunately drinks in the will of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 qQw iprm rs

Shabad OS B.translation: Elixir of love

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rsu iCA rs hYrwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Chhia Ras Hairaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the six tastes (satras) are full of wonder before the gurmukh’s delightful fruit in the form of elixir of love.

lines.gurmukhi: CqIh AMmiRq qrsdy ivsmwd ivfwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Chhateeh Anmrit Tarasaday Visamaad Vidaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thirty six types of repasts, getting aweful before its grandeur, crave for being equal to it.

lines.gurmukhi: inJr Dwr hjwr hoie BY cikq Bulwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Nijhar Dhaar Hajaar Hoi Bhai Chakit Bhulaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even myriads of currents of delight flowing through the tenth gate become full of wonder and fear before it.

lines.gurmukhi: ieVw ipMgulw suKmnw sohM n smwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Irhaa Pingulaa Soukhamanaa Sohan N Samaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The taste of the recitation of Soham in the base of ira, pingala and susumna nerves is not equal to the taste of the elixir of love.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh cVwau ciV prcw prvwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Charhaau Charhi Parachaa Paravaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Going beyond the animate and inanimate i.e. the whole world, the consciousness is merged in the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pIqY boil n hMGeI AwKwx vKwxw ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Peetai Boli N Hanghaee Aakhaan Vakhaanaa ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Then the situation turns out to be such that as one cannot speak while drinking, the talk of drinking of the elixir of love becomes ineffable.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 Almsq vrxn

Shabad OS B.translation: Description of the delight

lines.gurmukhi: glI swdu n AwveI ijcru muhu KwlI
lines.transliteration_english: Galee Saadu N Aavaee Jicharu Muhu Khaalee.

Shabad OS B.translation: So long as a tasty object enters not the mouth, mere talking about taste cannot bring any joy.

lines.gurmukhi: muhu BirAY ikauN bolIAY rs jIB rswlI
lines.transliteration_english: Muhu Bhariai Kioun Boleeai Ras Jeebh Rasaalee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When holding the object the mouth is full of taste and tongue full of delight, how could one speak?

lines.gurmukhi: sbdu suriq ismrx aulMiG nih ndir inhwlI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadu Surati Simaran Ulaghi Nahi Nadari Nihaalee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Going past the stage of recitation those whose consciousness gets merged in the Word, do not see anything except the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pMQu kupMQu n suJeI Almsq iKAwlI
lines.transliteration_english: Pandu Koupandu N Sujhaee Alamasat Khiaalee.

Shabad OS B.translation: For the people drenched in love, good or bad ways have not meaning.

lines.gurmukhi: fgmg cwl suFwl hY gurmiq inrwlI
lines.transliteration_english: Dagamag Chaal Suddhaal Hai Guramati Niraalee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wobbling gait of the person full of love for the wisdom of the Guru (gurmat) looks distinctly beautiful.

lines.gurmukhi: ciVAw cMdu n lukeI Fik joiq kunwlI ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Charhiaa Chandu N Loukaee Ddhaki Joti Kounaalee ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the moon emerged in the sky of heart cannot remain hidden in spite of efforts to cover its light with flour kneading basin.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 iprm rs

Shabad OS B.translation: Elixir of love

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK bwvn cMdnw lK Agr imlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Baavan Chandanaa Lakh Agar Miladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriads of sandals and fragrant sticks may be mixed;

lines.gurmukhi: lK kpUr kQUrIAw AMbr mihkMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Kapoor Kadooreeaa Anbar Mahikanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: With myriads camphor’s and musk’s the sky may be made full of fragrance;

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK gauVy myd imil kysr cmkMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Gaurhay Mayd Mili Kaysar Chamakanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: If myriads of saffron are mixed with yellow pigment of cow;

lines.gurmukhi: sB sugMD rlwiekY Argjw krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Sougandh Ralaai Kai Aragajaa Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: And of all these fragrances an incense stick is prepared;

lines.gurmukhi: lK Argjy Pulyl Pul PulvwVI sMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Aragajay Phulayl Phul Phulavaarhee Sanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then myriads of such sticks may be mixed with the fragrance of flowers and scents,

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl iprmrsu vwsU n lhMdy ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Vaasoo N Lahanday ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Even then all these cannot withstand the fragrance of the elixir of love of the gurmukh.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 iprm rs

Shabad OS B.translation: Joy of love

lines.gurmukhi: rUp srUp AnUp lK ieMdR purI vsMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Roop Saroop Anoop Lakh Indr Puree Vasanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of handsome people reside in the Indrapuri;

lines.gurmukhi: rMg ibrMg surMg lK bYkuMT rhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Rang Birang Surang Lakh Baikountd Rahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of beautiful people reside in the heaven;

lines.gurmukhi: lK jobn sIgwr lK lK vys krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Joban Seegaar Lakh Lakh Vays Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of young persons wear many types of attires;

lines.gurmukhi: lK dIvy lK qwirAwN joiq sUrj cMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Deevay Lakh Taariaan Joti Sooraj Chanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions are the lights of millions of lamps, stars, suns and moons;

lines.gurmukhi: rqn jvwhr lKmxI jgmg thkMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Ratan Javaahar Lakh Manee Jagamag Tahakanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of lights of jewels and rubies also glitter.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rs joqI n pujMdy ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Ras Jotee N Pujanday ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: But all these lights cannot reach up to the light of the elixir of love i.e. all these lights are pale before it.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 iprm rs

Shabad OS B.translation: Supereme delight

lines.gurmukhi: cwir pdwrQ iriD isiD iniD lK kroVI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Padaarad Ridhi Sidhi Nisi Lakh Karorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In all of the four ideals of life, riddhis, siddhis and myriads of treasures;

lines.gurmukhi: lK pwrs lK pwrjwq lK lKmI joVI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Paaras Lakh Paarijaat Lakh Lakhamee Jorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Philosopher’s stones, wish fulfilling trees and many varieties of wealth are collected;

lines.gurmukhi: lK icMqwmix kwmDyn cqurMg cmoVI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Chintaamani Kaamadhaynu Chaturang Chamorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriads of fabulous gems supposed to yield anything desired and wish fulfilling cows are also added to all this;

lines.gurmukhi: mwxk moqI hIirAw inrmol mhoVI
lines.transliteration_english: Maanak Motee Heeriaa Niramol Marorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Again invaluable jewels, pearls and diamonds are kept with all this;

lines.gurmukhi: lK kivlws sumyru lK lK rwj bhoVI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Kavilaas Soumayru Lakh Lakh Raaj Bahorhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriads of kailas and Sumer mountains are also gathered together;

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rs mulu Amulu suQoVI ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Mulu Amulu Sudorhee ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Even then they all have no standing at all before the invaluable elixir of love of the gurmukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 pRym ipAwly dI bUMd

Shabad OS B.translation: The drop of the cup of love

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl lK lK lK lhir qrMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Lakh Lakh Lakh Lahir Tarangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs identify the wave of delightful fruit among the illusionary waves of the world ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: lK drIAwau smwau kir lK lhrI AMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Dareeaau Samaau Kari Lakh Laharee Angaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They bear upon their body millions of waves of worldly rivers.

lines.gurmukhi: lK drIAwau smuMd ivic lK qIrQ gMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Dareeaau Samound Vichi Lakh Teerad Gangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriads of rivers are there in the ocean and likewise many are pilgrimage centres on the Ganges.

lines.gurmukhi: lK smuMd gVwV ivic bhu rMg ibrMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Samound Garhaarh Vichi Bahu Rang Birangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the oceans are millions of sea of varying forms and hues.

lines.gurmukhi: lK gVwV qrMg ivic lK AJu ikxMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Garhaarh Tarang Vichi Lakh Ajhu Kinangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such oceans may be visualized in one drop of the tears of love.

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlw pIvxw ko burw n cMgw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Piram Piaalaa Peevanaa Ko Buraa N Changaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Nothing is good or bad for the man who quaffs from the cup of love.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 byAMqqw

Shabad OS B.translation: The infinity

lines.gurmukhi: iek kvwau pswau kir EAMkwr suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaaru Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From one resonance the Oankar-Braham created the whole universe.

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwr lK bHmMf bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaari Akaar Lakh Brahamand Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The very Oankar assumed the form of millions of universes.

lines.gurmukhi: pMj qq auqpiq lK qRY loA suhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Panji Tatu Outapati Lakh Trai Loa Suhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Five elements were created, myriads of productions were made and all the three worlds were adorned.

lines.gurmukhi: jil Qil igir qrvr sPl drIAwv clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jalidali Giri Taravar Saphal Dareeaav Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He created water, earth, mountains, trees and made the holy rivers flow.

lines.gurmukhi: lK drIAwau smwau kir iql qul n qulwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Dareeaau Samaau Kari Til Tul N Tulaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He created great oceans that subsume in them myriads of rivers.

lines.gurmukhi: kudriq iek AqolvI lyKw n ilKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kudarati Ik Atolavee Laykhaa N Likhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A fraction of their grandeur cannot be explained. Only nature is infinite whose expanse cannot be counted.

lines.gurmukhi: kudriq kIm n jwxIAY kwdru ikin pwieAw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Kudarati Keem N Jaaneeai Kaadaru Kini Paaiaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: When nature is unknowable how could its creator be known?

lines.gurmukhi: 12 pRym pRXwly dI iek bUMd

Shabad OS B.translation: One drop of the cup of love

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu pRym rsu Aibgiq giq BweI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Praym Rasu Abigati Gati Bhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ineffable is the taste of the joy of love, which is the pleasure fruit of the gurmukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrwvwru Apwru hY ko Awie n jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Paaraavaaru Apaaru Hai Ko Aai N Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It’s this shore and the yonder one are beyond limits none can reach it.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid AMiq prjMq nwih prmwid vfweI
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Anti Parajant Naahi Paramaadi Vadaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its beginning and end are unfathomable and its grandeur is most eminent.

lines.gurmukhi: hwQ n pwie AQwh dI Asgwh smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Haad N Paai Adaah Dee Asagaah Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is so much that many of the oceans immerse in it yet its depth remains unknown.

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwly bUMd iek ikin kImiq pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Piram Piaalay Boond Ik Kini Keemati Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who could evaluate even one drop of such a cup of love.

lines.gurmukhi: Agmhu Agm AgwiD boD gur AlKu lKweI ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Agamahu Agam Agaadhi Bodh Gur Alakhu Lakhaaee ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: It is inaccessible and its knowledge is unfathomable, but the Guru can make one realise this imperceptible cup of love.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 pRym rs dI iek inmK

Shabad OS B.translation: One moment of the joy of love

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rsu iqlu AlKu AlyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Tilu Alakhu Alaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even a fraction of pleasure fruit of gurmukhs in the form of joy of love is imperceptible and beyond all accounts.

lines.gurmukhi: lK caurwsIh jUin ivic jIA jMq ivsyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Vichi Jeea Jant Visaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are the creatures in the eighty-four lacs of species.

lines.gurmukhi: sBnw dI romwvlI bhu ibiD bhu ByKY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhanaa Dee Romaavalee Bahu Bidhi Bahu Bhaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: They all have variegated colour of their trichomes.

lines.gurmukhi: roim roim lK lK isr muhu lK sryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Romi Romi Lakh Lakh Sir Muhu Lakh Saraykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If to their single hair millions of heads and mouths were joined;

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK muih muih jIBu kir suix bolY dyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Muhi Muhi Jeebhu Kari Souni Bolai Daykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If such million of mouths could speak through their millions of tongues;

lines.gurmukhi: sMK AsMK iekIh vIh smsr n inmyKY ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Sankh Asankh Ikeeh Veeh Samasari N Nimaykhai ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: If myriad times more the world were created, even then it cannot equal the one moment (of the delight of love).

lines.gurmukhi: 14 pRym rs ikkUM imldw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: How the joy of love is attained     ?

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl iprm rs huie guru isK mylw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Hui Guru Sikh Maylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: After meeting the Guru i.e. after adopting the teachings of the Guru, the gurmukh receives the pleasure-fruit of the joy of love.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq prcwie kY inq nyh nvylw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Parachaai Kai Nit Nayhu Navaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru merges the consciousness of the disciple into the Word and creates ever-new love for the Lord in it.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh cVwau ciV isK guru guru cylw
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Charhaau Charhi Sikh Guru Guru Chaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus getting above the worldliness, the disciple becomes Guru and the Guru disciple.

lines.gurmukhi: Aipau pIAY Ajru jrY gur syv suhylw
lines.transliteration_english: Apiu Peeai Ajaru Jarai Gur Sayv Suhaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now he quaffs the unbearable drink of the juice of love and further bears the unbearable. But all this becomes possible only through the service of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: jIvidAw mir clxw hwir ijxY vhylw
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevadiaa Mari Chalanaa Haari Jinai Vahaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: (To attain the delight of love) One has to put to death his ego and by becoming indifferent to the world has to conquer it.

lines.gurmukhi: isl AwlUxI ctxI lK AMmiRq pylw ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Sil Aloonee Chatanee Lakh Anmrit Paylaa ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who has licked this tasteless (unsalty) stone i.e. who has adopted the way of desireless devotion, he alone throws away myriads of delights equal to the immortalising elixirs.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 ibrd dI lwj

Shabad OS B.translation: Living up to one's natural repute

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI kwT n fobeI pwly dI ljY
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Kaatdu N Dobaee Paalay Dee Lajai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Water does not drown the wood because it lives up to its natural repute of nurturing the things (water rears up the vegetation).

lines.gurmukhi: isir klvqR DrwiekY isir ciVAw BjY
lines.transliteration_english: Siri Kalavatr Dharaai Kai Siri Charhiaa Bhajai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It bears the vessel on its head like a saw because the vessel shears the water and moves ahead.

lines.gurmukhi: lohy jVIAY boihQw Bwir Bry n qjY
lines.transliteration_english: Lohay Jarheeai Bohidaa Bhaari Bharay N Tajai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Of course, iron is studded into the wood but water bears the burden of it also.

lines.gurmukhi: pytY AMdir Aig riK iqsu pVdw kjY
lines.transliteration_english: Paytay Andari Agi Rakhi Tisu Parhadaa Kajai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Water knows that its enemy fire exists in wood but still it covers up this fact and does not drown it.

lines.gurmukhi: AgrY fobY jwix kY inrmolk DjY
lines.transliteration_english: Agarai Dobai Jaani Kai Niramolak Dhajai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sandal wood is knowingly drowned so that it is proved to be the real sandal wood and its price may be fixed higher.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrig clxw Cif KbY sjY ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maaragi Chalanaa Chhadi Khabai Sajai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of the gurmukhs is also the same; they without the caring for the loss and the profit go on moving further and further.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 hIrw

Shabad OS B.translation: Diamond

lines.gurmukhi: Kwix auKix kiF Awxdy inrmolk hIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Khaani Oukhani Kaddhi Aanaday Niramolak Heeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By digging into the mine the diamond is brought out.

lines.gurmukhi: jauhrIAw hiQ Awvdw auie gihr gMBIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jauhareeaa Hadi Aavadaa Ui Gahir Ganbheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then it goes into the hands of serene and great jewellers.

lines.gurmukhi: mjls AMdir dyKdy pwiqswh vjIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Majalas Andari Daykhaday Paatisaah Vajeeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the gatherings the kings and the ministers test and check it.

lines.gurmukhi: mulu krin Ajmwie kY swhw mn DIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Mulu Karani Ajamaai Kai Saahaa Man Dheeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The bankers in full confidence evaluate it.

lines.gurmukhi: Ahrix auqY riK kY Gx Gwau srIrw
lines.transliteration_english: Aharani Outai Rakhi Kai Ghan Ghaau Sareeraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Putting it on the anvil by the strokes of hammers its body is tried for wounds.

lines.gurmukhi: ivrlw hI Tihrwvdw drgh gur pIrw ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Viralaa Hee Tdahiraavadaa Daragah Gur Peeraa ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare one remains intact. Likewise any rare one reaches the court of the Guru (God) i.e. any rare one escapes the darkness of maya and its infatuations.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 gurmuK cwl

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of Gurmukhs

lines.gurmukhi: qir fubY fubw qrY pI iprm ipAwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Tari Doubai Doubaa Tarai Pee Piram Piaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One who quaffs the cup of love superficially drowns himself but in fact getting inebriated one who drowns in it swims it and gets across.

lines.gurmukhi: ijix hwrY hwrY ijxY eyhu gurmuiK cwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Jini Haarai Haarai Jinai Ayhu Guramoukhi Chaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This is the way of the gurmukhs that they lose while winning and losing everything they win one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: mwrgu KMfy Dwr hY Bvjlu Brnwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Maaragu Khanday Dhaar Hai Bhavajalu Bharanaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way into the world ocean is like a double edged sword is like a killing stone

lines.gurmukhi: vwlhu inkw AwKIAY gur pMQu inrwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaalahu Nikaa Aakheeai Gur Pandu Niraalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Which perishes everything, and the ill-advised intellect is the abode of evil deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: haumY bjru Bwr hY durmiq durwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Bajaru Bhaar Hai Duramati Duraalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The disciple of the Guru loses his ego through the Gurmat

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq Awpu gvwie kY isKu jwie suKwlw ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Aapu Gavaai Kai Sikhu Jaai Soukhaalaa ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: , the wisdom of the Guru and goes across this world ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 bohV qoN aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the expansion of banyan tree of the Sikhs of the Guru spread Nam

lines.gurmukhi: Driq vVY viV bIau hoie jVH AMdir jMmY
lines.transliteration_english: Dharati Varhai Varhi Beeu Hoi Jarh Andari Janmai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The seed enters the earth and settles in the form of root.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie brUtw cuhcuhw mUl fwl DrMmY
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Barootaa Chuhachuhaa Mool Daal Dharanmai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then in the form of verdant plant it becomes stem and branches.

lines.gurmukhi: ibrK Akwr ibQwru kir bhu jtw plMmY
lines.transliteration_english: Birakh Akaaru Bidaaru Kir Bahu Jataa Palamai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming tree it extends further and tangled branches hang from it.

lines.gurmukhi: jtw ltw imil Driq ivic hoie mUl AgMmY
lines.transliteration_english: Jataa Lataa Mili Dharati Vichi Hoi Mool Aganmai.

Shabad OS B.translation: These flourishing branches ultimately entering the earth again attain the form of roots.

lines.gurmukhi: CwNv GxI pq sohxy Pl l`K lKMmY
lines.transliteration_english: Chhaanv Ghanee Pat Sohanay Phal Lakh Lakhanmai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now its shade becomes think and leaves appear beautiful and millions of fruits grow on it.

lines.gurmukhi: Pl Pl AMdir bIA bhu gurisK mrMmY ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Phal Phal Andari Beea Bahu Gur Sikh Maranmai ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: In each fruit remain many seeds (and this process goes on). The mystery of the Sikhs of the Guru is the same; they also like banyan tree go on spreading the name of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 gur biR`C rUp

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru in the form of a tree

lines.gurmukhi: ieku isKu duie swD sMgu pMjIN prmysru
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Sikhu Dui Saadh Sangu Panjeen Paramaysaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: One is a Sikh, two the congregation and in five resides God.

lines.gurmukhi: nau AMg nIl AnIl suMn Avqwr mhysru
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Ang Neel Aneel Sounn Avataar Mahaysaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: As cyphers added to one make the infinite number, likewise getting attached with Sunya (God), the creatures also transform into great men and kings of the earth.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh AsMK sMK mukqy mukqysru
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Asankh Sankh Moukatai Moukataysaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: In this way innumerable small and big persons also become liberated and liberators.

lines.gurmukhi: ngir ngir mY shMs isK dys dys lKysru
lines.transliteration_english: Nagari Nagari Mai Sahans Sikh Days Days Lakhaysaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: In town after town and country after country are myriads of Sikhs.

lines.gurmukhi: iekdUM ibrKhu lK Pl Pl bIA lomysru
lines.transliteration_english: Ikadoon Birakhahu Lakh Phal Phal Beea Lomaysaru.

Shabad OS B.translation: As millions of fruits are obtained from a tree and in those fruits remain millions of seeds (In fact the Sikhs are the fruits of the Guru-tree and in those fruits the Guru resides in the form of seeds).

lines.gurmukhi: Bog Bugiq rwjysurw jog jugiq jogysru ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhog Bhougati Raajaysuraa Jog Jougati Jogaysaru ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: These disciples of the Guru being enjoyers of delights are the emperors of the kings and being knower of the technique of yoga are kings of yogis.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 nwmI Swh

Shabad OS B.translation: A wealthy banker

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdw iprhVI vxjwry swhY
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Vanajaaray Saahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The love between the disciples and the Guru is the same as is there between a trader and a banker.

lines.gurmukhi: saudw iekqu hit hY sMswr ivswhY
lines.transliteration_english: Saudaa Ikatu Hati Hai Sansaaru Visaahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The merchandise of the name of the Lord is available only at one ship (of the Guru) and the whole world purchases there-from only.

lines.gurmukhi: koeI vycY kaufIAw ko dm augwhY
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Vaychai Kaudeeaa Ko Dam Ougaahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Some of the worldly shopkeepers are selling trash whereas others are collecting money.

lines.gurmukhi: koeI rupXy ivkxY suneIey ko fwhY
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Roupayay Vikanai Sounaeeay Ko Daahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Some are storing the gold coins after spending rupees;

lines.gurmukhi: koeI rqn vxMjdw kir isPiq slwhY
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Ratan Vananjadaa Kari Sidhati Salaahai.

Shabad OS B.translation: And there are some that are dealing in jewels of the eulogisation of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: vxij supqw swh nwil vyswhu inbwhY ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Vanaji Soupataa Saah Naali Vaysaahu Nibaahai ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare honourable banker having full faith in the Lord maintains this trade.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 siqgur Swh

Shabad OS B.translation: True Guru, the merchant

lines.gurmukhi: saudw iekqu hit hY swhu siqguru pUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Saudaa Ikatu Hati Hai Saahu Satiguru Pooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The perfect true Guru keeps the actual merchandise (of the name of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: Aaugux lY gux ivkxY vcnY dw sUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Aougoun Lai Goun Vikanai Vachanai Daa Sooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is that brave person who accepts the evils and upkeep’s his reputation of being giver of virtues.

lines.gurmukhi: sPlu krY isMmlu ibrKu sovrnu mnUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Saphalu Karai Sinmalu Birakhu Sovaranu Manooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He can grow juicy fruits on silk-cotton trees and can produce gold from the iron ash.

lines.gurmukhi: vwsu suvwsu invwsu kir kwau hMsu n aUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaasi Suvaasu Nivaasu Kari Kaau Hansu N Ooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He infuses fragrance in the bamboo i.e. he makes egotists feel humble and makes crows no less than swans who are capable of distinguishing water from milk.

lines.gurmukhi: GuGU suJ suJwiedw sMK moqI cUrw
lines.transliteration_english: Ghoughoo Sujhu Sujhaaidaa Sankh Motee Chooraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He transforms owls into knowledgeable ones and dust into conches and pearls.

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqybhu bwhrw gur sbdu hjUrw ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Kataybahu Baaharaa Gur Sabadi Hajooraa ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a Guru who is beyond the description of the Vedas and Katebas (the semitic scriptures becomes manifest by the grace of Word, the brahmn)

lines.gurmukhi: 22 guropmw

Shabad OS B.translation: Praise of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: lK aupmw aupmw krY aupmw n vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Oupamaa Oupamaa Karai Oupamaan Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: People praise the Guru through millions of ways and to do so take help of many comparisons.

lines.gurmukhi: lK mihmw mihmw krY mihmw hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Mahimaa Mahimaa Karai Mahimaa Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of people eulogise so much that even the eulogy feels wonder struck.

lines.gurmukhi: lK mhwqm mhwqmw n mhwqm jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Mahaatam Mahaatamaa N Mahaatamu Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of spiritualists explain the grandeur of Guru but they do not understand the same.

lines.gurmukhi: lK ausqiq ausqiq krY ausqiq n is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Ousatati Ousatati Karai Ousatati N Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of eulogisers recite praise s but they do not understand the real praise.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid purKu Awdys hY mYN mwxu inmwxY ]22]
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Hai Main Maanu Nimaanai ?22?

Shabad OS B.translation: I respectfully bow before such a primeval Lord who is the pride of the humble person like me.

lines.gurmukhi: 23 qQwc gur pRqwp

Shabad OS B.translation: Praise of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: lK miq lK buiD suiD lK lK cqurweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Mati Lakh Budhi Sudhi Lakh Lakh Chaturaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of sects, intellects, thoughts and skills may exist;

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK aukiq isAwxpwN lK suriq smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Oukati Siaanapaan Lakh Surati Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of phrases, techniques and methods of absorption into the consciousness may exist;

lines.gurmukhi: lK igAwn iDAwn lK lK ismrx rweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Giaan Dhiaan Lakh Lakh Simaran Raaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of knowledge’s, meditations and remembrance may be there;

lines.gurmukhi: lK ividAw lK iest jp qMq mMq kmweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Vidiaa Lakh Isat Jap Tant Mant Kamaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of education’s, recitations for the objectives and tantra-mantra praxis may exist;

lines.gurmukhi: lK Bugiq lK lK Bgiq lK mukiq imlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Bhougati Lakh Lakh Bhagati Lakh Moukati Milaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of delights, devotions and liberation’s may be mixed up,

lines.gurmukhi: ijau qwry idh augvY AwnHyr gvweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Taaray Dih Ougavai Aanhayr Gavaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: But as the darkness and the stars elope when the sun rises, likewise by losing all the objects mentioned above and by becoming the dear friend of the Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu Agmu hY hoie iprm sKweI ]23]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Agamu Hai Hoi Piram Sakhaaee ?23?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh can attain the unapproachable pleasure-fruit of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 24 vwihgurU mihmw

Shabad OS B.translation: Praises of Waheguru, the wondrous Lord

lines.gurmukhi: lK Acrj Acrj hoie Acrj hYrwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Acharaj Acharaj Hoi Acharaj Hairaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Beholding the wondrous Lord myriad’s of wonders become full of wonder.

lines.gurmukhi: ivsmu hoie ivsmwd lK lK coj ivfwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Visamu Hoi Visamaad Lakh Lakh Choj Vidaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing his wonderful deeds, the elation itself becomes elated.

lines.gurmukhi: lK AdBuq prmdBuqM prmdBuq Bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Adabhout Paramadabhoutee Paramadabhout Bhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Realising his marvellous Order many uncanny arrangements feel themselves full of wonder.

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq AgwD boD AprMpru bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Abigati Gati Agaadh Bodh Aparanparu Baanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His unmanifest position is unknowable and His form and guise is formless.

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw Ajpw jpxu nyiq nyiq vKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Ajapaa Japanu Nayti Nayti Vakhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His tale is ineffable; unrecited recitations are performed for Him but even He is described as neti neti(not this not that).

lines.gurmukhi: Awid prKu Awdysu hY kudriq kurbwxw ]24]
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Hai Kudarati Kurabaanaa ?24?

Shabad OS B.translation: I salute that primal Lord and I am sacrifice unto His feats.

lines.gurmukhi: 25 Cy gurU ismrx

Shabad OS B.translation: Remembering the six Gurus

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHmu pUrx bHmu gur nwnk dyau
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Gur Naanak Dayu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Nanak is perfect and transcendental Brahm.

lines.gurmukhi: gur AMgdu gur AMg qy sc sbd smyau
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Angadu Gur Ang Tay Sach Sabad Samayu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Angad attained merger in Word by being in the company of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: Amrwpdu gur AMgdhu Aiq AlK AByau
lines.transliteration_english: Amaraapud Gur Angadahu Ati Alakh Abhayu.

Shabad OS B.translation: After Guru Angad, the imperceptible and without duality, Guru Amas Das, the bestower of immortality has flourished.

lines.gurmukhi: gur Amrhu gur rwmdwsu giq ACl ACyau
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Amarahu Gur Raamadaasu Gati Achhal Achhayu.

Shabad OS B.translation: After Guru Amar Das, the forbearing and storehouse of infinite virtues, Guru Ram Das made manifest his existence.

lines.gurmukhi: rwm dws Arjx gurU Aibcl ArKyau
lines.transliteration_english: Raam Rasak Arajan Guroo Abichal Arakhayu.

Shabad OS B.translation: From Guru Ram Das, Guru Arjan Dev, who absorbed one in Ram-Nam, beyond all blemishes and immovable one, was born.

lines.gurmukhi: hirgoivMd goivMd guru kwrx krxyau ]25]
lines.transliteration_english: Hari Govindu Govindu Guru Kaaran Karanayu ?25?13?tayraan?

Shabad OS B.translation: Then came Guru Hargobind who is the cause of all the causes i.e. who is Gobind, the Lord himself.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: nwnw imstwn pwn bhu ibMjnwid sÍwd sIcq srb rs rsnw khweI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Naanaa Misataan Paan Bahu Binjanaadi Svaada , Seechat Sarab Ras Rasanaa Kahaaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Tongue that enjoys many forms of sweet and savoury foods, drinks and is relisher of all the tastes is called gustation. Eyes see good and bad, beautiful and ugly and is therefore known as vision power.

lines.gurmukhi: diRsit drs Aru sbd suriq ilv igAwn iDAwn ismrn Aimq bfweI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Drisati Daras Aru Sabad Surati Liva , Giaan Dhiaan Simaran Amit Badaaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ears for their ability to hear all sorts of sounds, melodies etc. are called hearing power. With the use of all these faculties, one obtains knowledge of various things, focuses one's mind in meaningful thoughts and earns worldly respect.

lines.gurmukhi: skl suriq Asprs Aau rwg nwd buiD bl bcn ibbyk tyk pweI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sakal Surati Asaparas Au Raag Naada , Budhi Bal Bachan Bibayk Tayk Paaee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The skin brings awareness of things through touch. Enjoyment of music and songs, intellect, strength, speech and dependence on discrimination is the boon of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siqnwm ismrq sPl huie bolq mDur Duin suMn suKdweI hY ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Satinaam Simarat Sadhal Hui , Bolat Madhur Dhouni Sounn Soukhadaaee Hai ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: But all these senses of knowledge are useful if a person obtains the boon of Guru's wisdom, dwells his mind in the name of the Immortal Lord and sings the sweet paeans of me Lord's name. Such tune and melody of His name is bestower of bliss and happiness.
